text: Uh hello and welcome to animation
authoring in Unreal Engine. The goal of
this talk is to get people up to speed
on the slate of tools available in
Unreal. Uh running through the standard
list of things every animator is going
to need along the way. Uh and a lot of
things that you didn't even know you
needed and that you can only do in
Unreal.
A quick bio on me. Uh I'm John Fielding.
I've been animating for about 15 years.
I've worked on everything from previs to
final animation and now gameplay
animation. Along the way, I've done
everything from mocap to hand keyed,
realistic, stylized. You name it, I've
probably done it. Um, I've also had the
opportunity to work with a lot of
different softwares like Motion Builder,
XSI, uh, and obviously Maya. Uh, the
main thing that I've learned across all
these softwares is that each one is
designed in a slightly different per way
and with a different purpose. So when
you look at it through that lens and you
really lean into the way that it does
the things that it was designed for, you
get unlocked creatively.
So I'm going to start by giving you this

like animation layers, viewport or
render. Uh but my goal here today is
